result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal M Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory court costs assessed.  To be paid during period of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. This may include cognitive intervention. 
Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.
Alcohol/drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. Random UA's at discretion of agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal M Johnson

Defendant Crystal M Johnson in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Crystal M Johnson in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with victim store except for restitution purposes, Walgreens.  Make all court appearances on time. This case has been assigned to Judge Constantine, Branch 7.
